script: I was absolutely shocked when we finally walked into the emergency all-hands meeting on Friday afternoon. Honestly, I really didn't expect the main auditorium to be that incredibly packed on a random summer afternoon. There were literally dozens of employees standing outside just waiting for an empty seat to open up in the back row. I mean, who schedules a massive company update right in the middle of peak vacation season? It completely threw off our entire departmental workflow for the rest of the busy week.

options: To explicitly emphasize genuine shock and disbelief at a highly unexpected corporate situation.
To aggressively complain to the CEO about the lack of comfortable seating in the auditorium.
To confidently boast about predicting exactly how crowded the company meeting would be.
To politely ask their manager what time the all-hands meeting usually wraps up.
question.prompt: Why does the employee start their sentence with the adverb 'Honestly'?

explanation: The speaker uses 'Honestly' as an emphatic pragmatical marker to underscore the absolute sincerity of their complete professional surprise.
